page.title: 16Railway
page.content: The Upton Community have a concern group who produce the Clarion Magazine. It won third prize in 1983-85 in the Dorset Village Ventures competition sponsored by Shell. The magazine covers coming events ,news,advertisements for clubs and business in the area. In one edition there was an interesting letter from a Mr.Perkins, with his memories of the Village from about 30 years ago. He talks about the Lychett railway crossing situated 200 yards east of Upton cross and controlled by a keeper from a signal box called Huberts Hideaway. In the early sixties the main railway line through Poole meant the closure of Upton railway on 2nd May 1964.Car traffic increased and spoilt Upton for him but the by-pass helped relieve the presssure. The old railway siting can still be seen.
